title: Grateful Dead - 1991-08-18 - Shoreline Amp in Mountainview, CA
description:
Grateful Dead
Sunday, August 18th, 1991
Shoreline Amphitheatre

Mountain View, CA

        


SBD/AUD MATRIX



DSBD: 

Source:
  - SB DAT 48khz low-gen clone (on 60 min/120 minute audio dats, 93?)
  - Sony PCM-1 /  7 pin
  - Nightengale PCI / Optical (reverse format)
  - Ce Pro 2000 Record 48k
  - Ce Pro 2000 Down sample to 44k / highest quality, pre-post filter
  - CDWav / ShnTool / FLAC


DAUD: 

Sennheiser ME-80's > Technics SV-MD1

DAT MASTER > Tascam DA-30MKII > Sound Devices 702 > Soundforge 9 (Fades & Sample Rate Conversion)> CDWAV > FLAC



Patch Source:

SBD > DAT > ZA2 > CDR > EAC


--- Set 1 ---

01) crowd/tuning
02) Hell In A Bucket
03) Jack-A-Roe
04) C.C. Rider->
05) It Takes A Lot To Laugh It, Takes A Train To Cry
06) Beat It On Down The Line
07) West L.A. Fadeaway
08) Masterpiece
09) Stagger Lee
10) Johnny B. Goode

     

--- Set 2 ---

01) crowd/tuning
02) Deal->
03) Samson And Delilah
04) Mississippi Half-Step Uptown Toodleloo
05) Feel Like A Stranger->
06) Drums->
07) Space->
08) China Doll->
09) Goin' Down The Road Feelin' Bad->
10) Throwing Stones->
11) Not Fade Away
12) NFA chant


--- Encore ---
01) Brokedown Palace







Hansokolow's notes:

As with the previous night, these sources worked very well together, and the matrix was relatively easy to put together.  I was at this show, one of the few Hornsby-era shows I caught, and I remember being very impressed with the new sound, and surprised by the setlist.  

A lot of people were predicting the second verse of Dark Star, no dice.  But the C.C. Rider -> Train To Cry in the first set was just breathtaking.  Kicked my ass.  A hot and mysterious West L.A. Fadeaway also got the boat rocking.  

I figured we'd probably get a China -> Rider to start the second set and an Other One out of Drumz, the expected.  I was not predicting three first set songs in the pre-drums segment and a rare (for me) China Doll.  

This show definitely stands out.
